title: Online Education Based on Merrill's Instructional Design for Enhancing Statistical Concept Interpretation Competency

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Self-directed learning environment using digital devices (laptops/tablets) for job-seeking students in psychology and social sciences.

learning_goals: Learners can interpret real-world applications of statistical concepts (significance level, p-value, confidence interval) with 80% accuracy through activities designed according to Merrill’s instructional design principles (realism, feedback, etc.)
Learners can perform hypothesis testing step-by-step using simulation tools provided in the LMS and write result reports
Learners can submit final deliverables explaining statistical significance with evidence after analyzing real research data through project-based assessment
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
